ICC Cricket World Cup, 12th Match, Pool A: Afghanistan v Sri Lanka at Dunedin, Feb 22, 2015
Scorecard | Commentary | Wickets | Partnership table | Player v player table | Over comparison | Career averages | Report | Article index (10) | Photo index (25) | Hawk-Eye | Wagon wheel | Manhattan | Worm | Run rate graph | Player v player graph | Partnership graph | Scoring shots graph | Wickets pie | Extras pie
ICC Cricket World Cup - 12th match, Pool A
Afghanistan v Sri Lanka
Sri Lanka won by 4 wickets (with 10 balls remaining)
ODI no. 3609 | 2014/15 season
Played at University Oval, Dunedin (neutral venue)
22 February 2015 (50-over match)
  Afghanistan innings (50 overs maximum) R M B 4s 6s SR
Javed Ahmadi c Herath b Lakmal 24 41 23 4 0 104.34
9.4 83.4 mph, short delivery which cramps Ahmadi for space as he looks to pull this one away through midwicket, but really was in no position to execute the stroke as this ends up going off the top-edge high towards midwicket, who is able to safely get under it in the end. Ahmadi is disgusted with himself as he storms off the pitch 40/2
Nawroz Mangal c Thirimanne b Mathews 10 34 30 1 0 33.33
8.1 74.2 mph, and straightaway he does the damage as he delivers this military medium-paced delivery on off which is chipped straight to silly mid-off, who takes a simple catch 34/1
Asghar Stanikzai c Mendis b Herath 54 80 57 5 1 94.73
27.1 45.8 mph, advances down the track to try and hammer Herath over cow corner, but doesn't quite middle it so as he ends up holing out to the fielder in the deep. Ends a spirited knock from the Afghanistan batsman, who has played a wonderful hand for his team 128/3
Samiullah Shenwari c Mathews b Perera 38 93 70 5 0 54.28
32.5 82.4 mph, Thisara gets some reward with plugging away at this line outside of off as Shenwari ends up throwing it away with a hard slap to mid-off, who takes it comfortably at stomach-height 157/4
Mohammad Nabi* b Malinga 21 34 27 2 1 77.77
35.4 83.3 mph, Nabi temporarily forgets who he is facing off too as he attempts another midwicket heave, but plays down the wrong line as the ball collides into the leg stump after he went through with the stroke. The skipper has to go as Afghanistan teeter every so delicately on 169 for 5 169/5
Najibullah Zadran c Perera b Lakmal 10 28 15 0 1 66.66
38.1 86.6 mph, sent soaring high in the air by Zadran, as he attempted to go down the ground, with Perera taking the catch somewhere near the non-striker's. Another blow as we head into the business end of the innings 175/6
Afsar Zazai† c Herath b Malinga 19 65 38 1 0 50.00
49.4 74.2 mph, and the innings comes to a close just a few balls before the quota as Zazai, looking for quick runs, ends up holing out to the slip who has to back away a couple of faces after the mis-timed slog didn't quite come off. Herath takes the catch comfortably 232/10
Mirwais Ashraf c Lakmal b Malinga 28 39 32 1 2 87.50
47.4 71.3 mph, another slow delivery which this time falls in the general vicinity of a fielder as Mirwais top-edges this attempted pull to hole out directly at long leg. Afghanistan seven down now with not too many deliveries to face in the innings 221/7
Dawlat Zadran b Mathews 4 5 5 1 0 80.00
48.5 77.6 mph, Mathews strikes timber as Dawlat's brief stay comes to a close as he plays all around this fuller one on the stumps, with the ball taking care of the rest 227/8
Hamid Hassan c Mendis b Mathews 0 2 1 0 0 0.00
48.6 79.2 mph, Mathews on a hat-trick next game as Zazai has to go now after failing to clear midwicket with this lusty blow, instead hitting it straight up in the air, with Jeevan running hard over on the leg side to settle under it 227/9
Shapoor Zadran not out 1 5 1 0 0 100.00
Extras (lb 6, w 16, nb 1) 23
  Total (all out; 49.4 overs; 213 mins) 232 (4.67 runs per over)

  BMAJ Mendis 3 0 13 0 4.33 9 1 0
  Sri Lanka innings (target: 233 runs from 50 overs) R M B 4s 6s SR
HDRL Thirimanne lbw b Dawlat Zadran 0 1 1 0 0 0.00
0.1 83.1 mph, and what a way to get Afghanistan off and rocking as he delivers a full delivery on the pads which strikes Lahiru in line. The keeper and slips know he is gone right away as the umpire doesn't hesitate to raise the finger. This was definitely in line, and hitting the back pad 0/1
TM Dilshan c †Afsar Zazai b Shapoor Zadran 0 7 1 0 0 0.00
1.2 83.7 mph, Shapoor is the man in Dunedin. Gets across a back of a length delivery at good pace, and carry off the deck. Dilshan, facing his very first ball, ends up tickling an edge to the keeper after this bounced a little more on him than he expected. Both openers in the shed with just eight deliveries bowled in the innings. Afghanistan off to a fantastic start! 2/2
KC Sangakkara† b Hamid Hassan 7 28 13 1 0 53.84
5.3 87.7 mph, breaks through Sangakkara's defence as Hamid Hassan has set the University Oval on fire! The Big Kahuna falls as he is beaten through the gate to this one swinging in from wide of off, with Hamid Hassan putting in a rather awkward cartwheel to finish off the celebrations 18/3
FDM Karunaratne c Nawroz Mangal b Hamid Hassan 23 47 32 3 0 71.87
11.6 86.7 mph, Hamid Hassan is producing the good as he gets Dimuth to go after a length delivery outside of off which catches the outside edge to provide a straightforward chance to the slip, who is able to complete the catch after fumbling the first take. Hassan gets down on one knee and looks to the heavens, almost Freddie-Flintoff style. Sri Lanka four down and in a world of trouble 51/4
DPMD Jayawardene c Nawroz Mangal b Hamid Hassan 100 148 120 8 1 83.33
41.2 85.6 mph, Hassan is the man with the golden gun as he has managed to prise out the wicket all of Afghanistan would have wanted. Gets Mahela to flick at this back of a length through third man aerially, with this hit well enough to fly comfortably to third man in the deep, who takes it safely. Big, big blow as Hassan falls to his feet and then looks to the heavens once more. Afghanistan back into this I reckon, but Sri Lanka still ahead on the equation 178/6
AD Mathews* run out (Mohammad Nabi) 44 115 81 2 0 54.32
40.3 from Shapoor Zadran, Mathews looks like he has fallen just short of his ground as they attempted a quick single to this one played softly on the leg side. The close-in fielder is able to pick it up and fire in a direct hit in one fell swoop to throw down the striker's end, with the captain inches away. Ends a terrific rearguard 44 as he slams the dressing room window after storming his way back to the pavilion 177/5
BMAJ Mendis not out 9 39 17 0 0 52.94
NLTC Perera not out 47 32 26 6 1 180.76
Extras (lb 2, w 3, nb 1) 6
  Total (6 wickets; 48.2 overs; 208 mins) 236 (4.88 runs per over)

Did not batHMRKB Herath, SL Malinga, RAS Lakmal

Match details

Toss - Sri Lanka, who chose to field
Points - Sri Lanka 2, Afghanistan 0
Player of the match - DPMD Jayawardene (Sri Lanka)
Umpires - CB Gaffaney and RK Illingworth (England)
TV umpire - JD Cloete (South Africa)
Match referee - BC Broad (England)
Reserve umpire - BNJ Oxenford (Australia)

Match Coverage

Mathews, Malinga restrict Afghanistan to 232
Play

A half-century from Asghar Stanikzai showed some promise for Afghanistan before the innings stagnated against Sri Lanka in Dunedin | February 22, 2015

Play

A half-century from Asghar Stanikzai showed some promise for Afghanistan before the innings stagnated against Sri Lanka in Dunedin | February 22, 2015
